intro: Malachra officinalis, commonly known as the medicinal thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a rough texture, and it thrives in warm, dry climates. Due to its historical use in traditional medicine, it has been the subject of various botanical and pharmacological studies.
